page.title: 05Textiles in the Colne Valley
page.content: Weaving woollen cloth was an important cottage industry in the Colne Valley. The industrial revolution saw an expansion of textiles in the valley with many large mills being built. Many are now closed, but some like John Crowthers still produce woollen cloth. The raw wool at John Crowthers now comes from Australia and New Zealand. The wool is first blended and mixed before being spun into yarn.The yarn is dyed before being woven into cloth. Crowthers mill today employ 400 people but only 15 years ago provided work for 2000 people. Some of the mill buildings are now rented to other businesses outside the textile trade. Crowthers' cloth is sold and made into a variety of woollen products.
